page.title: 12BECKLEY SCHOOL - BUILDINGS
page.content: The oldest part of the school is the hall built in 1895 which was originally two classrooms but is now used for morning assembly, drama, P.E. and singing, etc. In 1974 a kitchen was added to the hall and about 50% of the children have a hot meal at midday. The others bring sandwiches. Meals are eaten in the hall. On the other side of the playground are the classrooms built in 1968 and 1974. There is also a headmaster's study and a staffroom. Alongside the playground is the former toilet building, now used as a P.E. store and workshop, and a shelter to house the school mini-bus, a Morris Sherpa. Behind the fence is the school heated swimming-pool and changing rooms erected by parents in 1985.
